definition: to store/to save/to have in reserve/heir/Taiwan pr. [chu2]

sentences.english: But the weak states remain vulnerable to a loss of confidence by depositors.
sentences.chinese: 一旦储户信心丧失，弱国仍将面临巨大风险。

sentences.english: The deposit amount is set by the depositor and the accrued interests are paid by installment.
sentences.chinese: 存款金额由储户自定，分期支取本息。

sentences.english: The depositor positively positioned the preposition in that position on purpose.
sentences.chinese: 储户有意确信地介词放置在那个位置。

sentences.english: It has lent more than $25m to 7,300 borrowers.
sentences.chinese: 它已经给7300名储户贷款了2500多万美元。

sentences.english: You'll have a deposit certificate in the name of the depositor.
sentences.chinese: 那就要一张以储户名字开立的定期存单。

sentences.english: Since then the bank has opened 1 million accounts that hold 12 tons of gold.
sentences.chinese: 迄今已有储户一百万，黄金总持有量12吨。

sentences.english: German also coughed up a couple hundred million, which will be used to make German depositors whole.
sentences.chinese: 德国也拿出数亿用来为保护德国储户利益。
一个储户又能做什么呢？

sentences.english: SEP IRAs are simple investment accounts controlled by the saver.
sentences.chinese: 简易雇员退休金计划是由储户控制的简易的投资帐户。

sentences.english: If we have more savers, our economy will shrink.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们有更多的储户，我们的经济会萎缩。

sentences.english: In this economic environment, savers are losers and debtors are winners.
sentences.chinese: 在这样的经济环境下，储户是输家，债务人是赢家。

sentences.english: Steinbrueck explained Germanys decision to promise full deposit protection for individual savers.
sentences.chinese: 施泰因布吕克解释了德国充分保护个人储户的决定。

definition: to withdraw money from a bank
Central Bank of the Republic of China (Taiwan)
to deposit money (in a bank etc)/bank savings/bank deposit
